snippet: Human traffickers rammed a boat with up to 500 migrants off the coast of Malta, causing most of them to drown, the International Organization for Migration said.
abstract: International Organization for Migration says human traffickers rammed boat filled with migrants they were smuggling from North Africa to Europe, making it sink in open sea and drowning hundreds of migrants; group says ramming happened after argument between traffickers and passengers, and only nine people of as many as 500 are known to have survived.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Fares Akram from Gaza; Jim Yardley from Pozzallo, Sicily; David D. Kirkpatrick from Baghdad; and Merna Thomas from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Human traffickers rammed a boat with up to 500 migrants off the coast of Malta, causing most of them to drown, the International Organization for Migration said.

headline.main: Smugglers Rammed Migrants’ Boat, Sinking It, Group Says
headline.print_headline: Smugglers Rammed Migrants’ Boat, Sinking It, Group Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
